triageFlags.title: Excessive Debt-to-Income Ratio
triageFlags.description: The applicant's DTI ratio is significantly above the allowable threshold for their credit tier.
triageFlags.recommendation: Decline the application due to unsustainable affordability.
triageFlags.reasoning: According to the policy, Tier B applicants must have a DTI ratio of 40% or less. The applicant's DTI ratio of 11000% is far beyond this limit, indicating severe affordability issues.

triageFlags.title: Implausible Income Reporting
triageFlags.description: The reported net income is implausibly low for the proposed financial obligations.
triageFlags.recommendation: Request clarification or evidence of income; otherwise, decline the application.
triageFlags.reasoning: The reported net income of £20 per month is not sufficient to support the proposed monthly instalment of £850, indicating either a reporting error or a significant affordability issue.

content.reasoning: The applicant's DTI ratio significantly exceeds the maximum allowable threshold for their credit tier, and the reported income is implausibly low for the proposed financial obligations. These factors indicate a high risk of default.
